Reviews.Content: A trip back in time We had stayed in this hotel about 5 years prior to our trip and were very pleased to stay here again. This time we booked the tower room. Basically an elevator takes you to the 5th floor and it is then quite a hike to the very top of the tower (60 steps). Because the stairs are so narrow and twisting, not much furniture of comfort could be taken up, but to stay in a tower dating back to the 13th or 14th century was an experience we will not forget. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The staff would often stop and chat with us and on the morning that we left (at 5am to catch a flight), they insisted that they make us a cappucino before we left (probably the best one of our trip too). The breakfast was limited but satisfactory.The location is great and if we go back to Florence again we will always have this hotel as our hotel of choice. While other hotels might be more to the North American standards and comfort level, this hotel just provides such a wonderful piece of history to experience.
Reviews.Author: Euroguy66

Reviews.Content: One of a kind The reviews on this hotel vary wildly. It is the oldest hotel in Florence and the 2nd oldest hotel in Italy, and that should tell you something. This place has a lot of old world character. That sounds great but most of us are used to modern properties. We are a family of 4 with two teen boys (16  18). I booked this hotel based on the recommendation of a friend who loves this hotel and always stays in the ancient tower. This tower is part of the hotel and is 700 years old. It is also know as the Torre Monalda. The cool thing about staying here, apart from the fact that is is one of the city's original watch towers is that it consists of a small bathroom, small bedroom with two twins, larger bedroom with sink in room, and the grand prize is the top floor living area. This top floor, like the rest of the rooms, is sparsely furnished but has a fantastic view. There are approx 12 windows over looking the city, remember it was a watch tower. The tower is higher that all the other building except for the duomo and one other palace. The tower has air conditioning but you can also open the windows and catch some wonderful breezes. You can not book this room online...you need to call the hotel directly.We enjoyed staying here, but my husband did compare it to camping out. All of the furnishings seemed to be about 30 years old or older. Lamps you haven't seen since visiting grandma as a child. This is a tower ,so the stair case winds around and around as you climb by the opening to the rooms. So if you don't do stairs, these rooms are not for you. The top room does have a small TV and fridge. I read some reviews that compared it to a haunted castle but we did not find it scary at all.The location could not be better. It is on the same block at Hotel Davanzati, trip advisors #1 hotel. Breakfast is fine, very traditional European breakfast with rolls, yogert, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, packaged cheese spread etc. It is served in a very nice breakfast room. The lobby and check in desk were very unique and beautiful in their own way. See pictures on the hotel web site. The hotel workers were very nice to us and even joked with our sons. The man who took our bags up to the room told us he was made in Egypt. Most of the other workers seemed to be Italian. They do not speak much English and are not conversational. We had the hotel make reservations for us to the Accademia and Uffizzi. Definately the way to go! It eliminated waiting in line and the tour guides were wonderful. We walked to the hotel from the train station, actually we walked everywhere. The Porta Rossa is very reasonably priced and has a wonderful location in the heart of Florence. This hotel is different and not for everyone, but where else can you stay in an ancient tower with enough space for a family.
Reviews.Author: Judy88

Reviews.Content: In touch with history Stayed here one night due to our flight being cancelled. It was probably the last available room in Florence that night and they didn't rip us off at all on the price, for which we are grateful - most other room providers took full advantage of the situation to rip off our fellow travellers in the same situation that night. Found it to be an amazing hotel in terms of character, and agree with nearly all the more complimentary comments on the accommodation, breakfast service and excellent location of the hotel that have been made recently. Our room was huge, a bit basic yes but interesting old / antique furniture, everything worked, it would cost a fortune to bring this place up to a more modern standard and by doing so its appeal would be lost. We think the hotel management have the right approach, its not for some but thank goodness for an individual approach. Its a matter of what you want, I would happily stay a week here, I think my wife would want something a little smarter, - but then we are nearly at retirement age, not young things any more! We were in room 88, top floor. Housekeeping standard in our room very satisfactory, bed linen spotless, ditto bathroom, and we had plenty of towels. Breakfast not fantastic considering the price of the accommodation but very acceptable, fresh tasting bread, fruit, etc (coffee from help yourself urn revolting but much better from the counter we were advised by others - unfortunately the member of staff serving it disappeared!). Two things only on the negative side -an unpleasant smell, quite strong, persisted in the corridor outside our room, (not, I stress, at all in evidence inside the room), this was particularly off putting as we were being shown up! - and all the comments made already about the lack of civility and to some extent the personal grooming of the reception team are only slightly (in our limited experience of the place) exaggerated. They were quick and efficient, but no hint of a welcoming smile and a lesson or two in personal grooming was needed here and there. You walk into the wonderful (albeit faded glory) reception and are treated like an item on a conveyor belt , with a different face to face approach to customers this hotel could shine!
Reviews.Author: hotel-owner-cumbria

Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel close to everything       Room 85 Bathroom
Reviews.Author: IVernazza

Reviews.Content: avoid at all costs... We should have read the reviews before we booked but ptnr had stayed theye 20 years ago when it was nice. (apparently) Staff are the most unprofessional, unfriendly, miserable people we have ever met. They should all be shot or completely retrained from scratch The management team should be ashamed of itself.Rooms less than basic - beds not very comfortable and the breakfast offering in the land of ham and fruit was pre packed and miserbale (same with the staff here too) I have been in better road side caffs!bathooms left a lot to be desired and the whole place need gutting and staring over - inlcuding the distaster they call reception. My Aunties budgie gives me a warmer welcome.We stayed in Venice 2 days before hand in similar star value hotel and that was fantatsic - it makes a complete mockery of the rating systems. DO NOT GO HERE.
Reviews.Author: guyzemail

Reviews.Content: Great Experience       View of breakfast room from above
Reviews.Author: pancakesisters9

Reviews.Content: Wouldnt touch with barge pole Decided on a whim to spend a short two night break in Florence. We had been staying up in the mountains of Tuscany for the previous week and thought it would be nice to see the sounds and sounds of the wonderful city of Florence. Alas it was our misfortune to stumble across the Porta Rossa Hotel.Words to describe this hotel are as follows: Bleak, tired, noisy, basic and delapidated should cover it. The room we were given I wouldn't have allowed our dog to sleep in it. Hotels of this ilk purely rely on their location alone to win their custom, and clearly have not reinvested in the infrastucture for many years. This hotel clearly needs updating and soundproofing however should the owners decide to spend some serious money on this operation they clearly would be the owners of one of Florences best hotels.
Reviews.Author: pete32

Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to most of the major 'must sees' in the City My sister treated me to a week end break in Florence knowing it's my favourite city in Europe (probably worldwide ). I was thrilled of course but her little 'find' for our short stay was great This hotel supposed to be the oldest 'inn' of Florence was so convenient - all the down sides, of which there were a few, were compensated by the fact we did not have to spend money on taxis, hire cars (which is virtually impossible as driving and parking in any Italian city as one knows is a complete no no.......Stones throw away from Ponte Vecchio, Duomo, main shopping streets, Piazzas and most important we could walk from the main Santa Maria Novella Railway station. Yes even pulling our own suitcases along was not too much a problem. In fact that is one of the beauties of Florence, many visitors can be seen doing just that and no one bats an eyelid. Better to spend the money on a bus trip from outside the Bagnioli hotel to Siena or San Gimignano, or eat out in one of the fab restaurants or even enjoy cocktails and a meal at the Savoy if you want to splash out. Hotel is basic, in fact we had the distinct impression it was like a converted convent, but we were told that it had always been a hotel. Our room was very large, high ceiling, twin beds very clean no nonsense ward robe and drawer space and bathroom practical but certainly not Relais  Chateaux - simple would be the correct adjective. No extras apart from a small bar of soap and those awful flimsy towels that I always put on a par with a dishcloth. Take your own towel or by one at Rinacente. The rooms on the back were quite noisy as there is a small road that the ubiquitous moped use as a cut through and the dustbins were collected quite early or late whatever time you retire. I managed to fuse the whole hotel one evening with hair tongues but just outside our door was the main board so we quickly flipped the trip switch. Breakfast was OK normal bread, coffee, watered down juice, fruit yoghurt tea, etc. I don't know how much she paid for the trip, it would not have been too expensive, but I do know I would certainly recommend it for ease of access, and we felt perfectly safe and comfortable walking to and from the hotel at all times of the day and night from all parts of the city.Would recommend to students, women travellers, (dont know about anyone with walking probs as cant remember seeing a lift)
Reviews.Author: Time Travellers' Wife

Reviews.Content: Needs a total revamp This hotel could be a really nice place if the management didn't have such a one-star attitude about it. It's in an excellent location, and is a grand old historic building, but the hotel fails to provide the most basic service any hotel should provide, which is to ensure a good night's sleep to its guests. On a Saturday night in late November, sleeping was impossible, except for the two or three hours after the last revellers in the nightclub below sang their way down the street and before the church bells started clanging. At the very least the hotel should install double-glaze windows. Also, the front desk staff require not only a course on basic civility, but a few tips personal grooming too.
Reviews.Author: Itaiphile

Reviews.Content: Absolute Nightmare - do not stay here! We were recommended this hotel by a collegue and booked for 3 nights but unfortunately it was a complete disaster. On arrival in the room it was very large and cold and not 'antique' as we were advised, we asked if there were anymore rooms available but others we were shown were small and dark so we stuck with the large room. It was also a disabled room so was kitted out with all the extra seats and rails something we were not advised when booking. The bathroom was like an old hospital bathroom and had a pair of dirty knickers in there!! we asked politely for them to be moved and were greeted with a very rude man who came to collect them and just muttered away to himself. We contemplated leaving but decided to stick it out for one night - we froze at night and hardly slept - so hardly a romantic hotel!! Went to shower in the morning and decided against it on seeing the mould on the back of the shower curtain!Breakfast was dreadful and like being back in time - staff rude and not helpful so we checked out and paid the ridiculous cost of 178 euros and went straight to the Pitti Palace which was fabulous!
Reviews.Author: SB5

Reviews.Content: Great location, interesting building, not for everybody. This hotel isn't for everyone. I stayed here for 5 nights in late October. The room was booked through a travel agent and it was absolutely enormous with very high ceilings. That was probably the best part, and since the hotel is so centrally located, it was very nice to be able to walk everywhere and be able to quickly come back to the hotel. The hotel is in a pedestrian zone so noise wasn't really a problem (although the stone buildings of Florence really amplify street noise).  The hotel is in a historical building (a former palazzo turned into a hotel in the 19th century) and is full of old stained glass, furniture, woodwork. The hotel is clean and the staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was nothing special and the fantastic high-ceilings are bathed in a horrible electric light from energy saving bulbs. The hotel is fine - it's Old World but doesn't necessarily have much charm - definitely not a place where you would want to linger in the lobby and enjoy the atmosphere. I enjoyed it but probably would try somewhere else the next time.
Reviews.Author: Banlon1964

Reviews.Content: Delightful Decaying Decadence I have stayed at this hotel both times I have been fortunate enough to visit Florence and will stay there everytime I return to Florence. It's decor is definitely shabby chic - grand style and you could spend a day exploring the huge common rooms with their unique furnishings. I love the Italian attitude to work and so I get on well with the staff. I also believe that work should not give you ulcers so I ask for information at off-peak times. It doesn't upset me if I have to wake the night staff for an early morning departure - after all why should they have to remain vigilant just in case a guest wants to check out early?The rooms are perfectly comfortable and some of the bathrooms are luxurious. For those guests who found the bathrooms too small I would suggest that they cut their intake of Mc Donalds! Prospective guests with imagination and a sense of history will be enthralled when they lay back and view the decaying fresco on their ceiling. They will feel a link to 16 centuries of italian history and look forward to their dreams - and isn't that what travel is about?May many more travellers dream in the Hotel Porta Rossa.
Reviews.Author: She40

Reviews.Content: would not recommend We had a 5 night stay in this hotel which was recommended to us by our travel agent on our tour. After reading the advertising blurb we were looking forward to a unique experience in a hotel with old world charm. This may still have been the case as we had a very large room overlooking Florentine rooftops which we thought was pleasant. The bathroom was average, old but clean as long as you ignored the rotting plaster in the ceiling. However particular members of the front desk staff were rude and unhelpful at a time when we had a problem in our travels. Other members were at best civil. Sleep was difficult to get as I was woken each night by some revellers which continued into the early hours of the morning and then woken by the rubbish trucks soon after.Next my belongings in my room seemed to have been disturbed and opened so I then locked them all in my suitcase when I went out for the day. However I did not lock my toiletries bag in my suitcase and expensive perfume and make-up went missing. This was the final straw. Of course there was no apology or admission of wrong doing. However my tour director has offered to reimburse me. It was a shame I had to have this experience and it could have been managed better.
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller101

Reviews.Content: Horrendous Staying in this hotel is obviously a completely hit or miss experience. It is clear from the reviews that those people who end up in large rooms have a wonderful stay and those who get put in the small rooms have a horrible time. My wife and I booked into the Porta Rossa on our last day of a 2 week Italian holiday as we had heard good things about the hotel. I was immediately taken aback by the rude attitude of the staff at check-in. The porter had to be woken from his slumber at mid-day to carry our bags and he was obviously not particularly impressed. The man behind the counter wanted very little to do with us and didn't seem particularly interested whether we stayed or not. The room was small, dirty and very definitely not 3 star.We stayed 15 minutes before carrying our own luggage back down the stairs, handing back the key, and leaving by one of the two front doors! I certainly wouldn't stay here again.
Reviews.Author: 1420krh

Reviews.Content: Pick somehwere else Stayed here in the heat of the summer. We had no control of the air conditioning and it was very hot. Staff is aloof and not very friendly. Breakfast is bad. The room size is good but I wouldn't call the furnishings antique - more like garage sale decor. Bathrooms have black mold in the shower - and it was no different with our traveling partners next door. The location is great but I'm not sure that makes the visit worth it.
Reviews.Author: susanlbinn

Reviews.Content: Interesting historic Hotel in great location, but some negatives Our family of 4 (kids ages 12  15) stayed for 4 nights in July and although the hotel is in a great location (near the Arno and designer boutiques) I honestly do not think we would stay there again. The staff was not friendly or helpful and our room was very loud at night due to local bars. However, breakfast and our quad room/bathroom were ok. There is a great little restaurant down the back street (nonna nella) that we highly recommend.Although we had booked the ancient tower suite when we saw it, there was no way my kids would agree to stay there. It was kinda scary with bedrooms on separate floor and it was hot/hot/hot. I don't think our luggage could have made it up the extra stairs. When we asked for another room, they were kind enough to find us another. Although my husband and I appreciated the hotel for its historic value, and our desire to avoid chain (sterile) hotels at all costs, I wish our stay had been better. Had the ancient tower suite been not so stark, the staff more friendly, we would have enjoyed ourselves more.
Reviews.Author: robinanne2000

Reviews.Content: Disgustingly Dirty Absolutely revolting... wouldn't let my dog stay at this hotel !!!! A lovely band aid from a previous guest greeted us when we turned down the sheets... yuk! And noisy with rude unhelpful staff who pretended not understand English. Never again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great value This is a smaller, charming hotel....nothing fancy but clean, quiet and great location on a side street close to everything. My room was cozy and full of character, with old wooden furniture and simple decorative touches. The bathroom could definitely have been bigger and little more comfortable. Overall, great value for the price, at least when I visited.
Reviews.Author: Squiggly

Reviews.Content: Good and bad location This hotel was in a great location for going out to see the sites but we were put on the first floor and it was very noisy every morning. The staff is nice and helpful but the first night they talked us into a close restaurant that was nothing great. Hard to get your stuff unloaded. The diver goes down a much used street (looks like an alley) and has to stop and hold up traffic as he unloads. This makes for a quick unload and load. Hotel is used by large tour groups so breakfast gets wiped out when they are done.
Reviews.Author: Trav25SouthernCalif_

Reviews.Content: Definitely One-of-a-Kind! The Porta Rossa is definitely a one-of-a-kind place. We have mixed feelings after three nights there in October. We paid about US $170/night. First the good: The building is amazing and we loved exploring the big stairways and hallways. There are little treasures everywhere: stained glass windows, lovely antique furnishings, old flags and keys, mirrors and tapestries. The location is PERFECT, close to everything. Housekeeping was prompt and meticulous, although we had the same sheets throughout our stay. Our room size was quite good -- maybe 15' x 15'. The price we paid seems pretty fair, considering the high prices everywhere in Florence. And the bad: our room was pretty miserable, dark and shabby, in the back of the building in a corner with the only window facing the back of another building about 10 feet away. The shower was the worst we encountered anywhere in Italy with low water pressure, a cheap plastic handheld wand, a cheap plastic door that didn't close right, and a cheap bar of soap smaller than a matchbook. While there is no traffic on the street in front, there is some sort of bar or nightclub nearby and we heard loud drunken screams, laughter and raucous singing from about 2 a.m. till 4 a.m. -- so loud it woke us up and kept us up. And the front desk and bellman pretty much ignored us despite our tipping them, not even looking up as we walked past with a chirpy buongiorno! Breakfast was pretty sad, too, but we didn't have high expectations in that department.Overall, the Porta Rossa is a cool and special place, and since we only were in the room from 10 pm until 8 am, it worked out fine. But our room sure wasn't a three-star room.
Reviews.Author: Chicagotripster

Reviews.Content: The Porta Rossa - A Hotel with Real Personality we were a bit unsure about this hotel as we had read some very positive reviews and some very negative ones... what swung it for us was simply the antiquity of the Porta Rossa, I mean to be able to say you lodged in the oldest hotel in Florence is pretty darn impressive! We asked the receptionist and he says that the building dates back to the 14th century!The hotel itself is full of personality as the bizarre billiard table in the breakfast room will tell you. breakfast itself isn't that good and you would expect more considering the price of 176 euro we paid for a double room but that was our only gripe.Some of the upper floors are definitely worth exploring especially if you are into antiques as there are some really splendid examples of 18 century furniture and ornaments. Our room was very big as we had booked a superior directly with the hotel through their own web site.The Location of the Hotel Porta Rossa cannot be beaten as it is right in the heart of the historical centre of Florence only steps away from the Ponte Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, Via dei Tornabuoni and all the wonderful attractions Florence has to offer. he front office manager (whose name I forget) was hospitable and friendly when approaced helping us with information and advice on nearby restaurants and sightseeing.We are already planning our trip back to Florence next year and intend fully on staying at the Hotel Porta Rossa.
Reviews.Author: pottyaboutitaly

Reviews.Content: The perfect place for easy sightseeing excellent value for money, literally steps away from the main places of interest and the reception staff are a fountain of knowledge you just have to press the right button i.e. tip them! the hotel is lovely although I would demand a superior room particularly if you have booked one (the hotel tends to give the standard rooms to the tour operators who pay a little less) The breakfast could be improved and I wouldn't suggest the hotel to businessmen as I am not sure the internet, technology side of hotel is up to date but nevertheless the hotel is sure to be a good choice for the people like me on a short weekend break.
Reviews.Author: lingo

Reviews.Content: A good night's sleep What is good about this hotel is that you are staying extremely centrally in a historic building. This is the oldest hotel in Florence, so there is a bit of cultural history in itself. It is clean and attractive and you will get a good night's sleep from the fact that Via Porta Rossa now is pedestrianized. No vespas or cars running up and down all night outside your window ! Hurrah ! On the other side of the hotel (Via delle Terme) there is some one-way traffic.The only thing that is below standard is the breakfast. You think you would be able to count on a good buffet breakfast when you pay 180 Euro for a double in a three star hotel. But this is Italy and Italians do not take breakfast seriously at all by our standards. But in the hotels they should, considering that most of the people that pay to stay there are not Italians and expect a lot more. Apart from this you will enjoy it, I think.
Reviews.Author: Bjorn

Reviews.Content: Weird, Wacky and Wonderful!!! I thought this hotel was awesome! Admittedly we booked a superior room through the official website of the hotel consequently maybe we were a little spoilt! Anyway, even if you are give a run of the house room you still cannot beat the Porta Rossa for its' sheer uniqueness, I mean what other hotel in Florence is housed in a medieval tower block, has 2 entrances opposite each other and a full size billiard table in the breakfast room - weird, wacky and wonderful! Plus the best thing of all is the hotel's location which is only minutes walk from the Ponte Vecchio, Piazza Signoria and Via dei Tornabuoni which contains the best designer shops in Florence for those women like me that enjoy a bargain!
Reviews.Author: jane_champion

Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else This hotel was in a great location, but that's the only good thing about it! My travel companions stayed in a double room, and I was in a single room next door. Their room was large, but their bathroom was very small. They had to open the shower door to wash their legs! My room was like a prison cell right down to the single lightbulb hanging over the twin bed. They provided me with one sachet of shower gel and a shoeshine kit, but no shampoo or bar soap. My companions had received bar soap and a shampoo sachet that was all dried up. One day, the maid removed the extra toilet paper from the rooms, and we had to take rolls out of the hotel's public bathroom so we had some. On another day, the maid smoked in my room. The rooms come with air conditioning units, but no controls are provided. If you want air, the staff come around with one master control to turn on your unit, but they don't leave you with the control. How dumb is that??? We froze at night and had no way to turn the temperature down for ourselves. We would have had to call the desk to come up and adjust it for us, and who wants to do that in the middle of the night? The breakfast was not good. We had rotten plums and bad coffee. I had to check out at 5:30am to catch my flight, but nobody was at the front desk to help me at that hour. Luckily, I saw a doorbell next to the front door, so I went outside and rang it, which awoke the man from his sleep on the sofa in the lobby. He stumbled over to the desk to check me out and call a taxi for me. I can't believe this place is rated as a 3-star hotel. It is more akin to a 1-star hotel in the States. It was definitely not worth the price we paid, and I would not recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not your average hotel The room was huge and had a lot of character. The hotel building is really old and the rooms have not been updated in my lifetime. The age is what makes this place unique but do not expect sound proof walls or windows that close tight. If you like a big room with charm then this is the place for you.The location could not be any more ideal. Only a few blocks from anything you want to see in Florence. The street in front is noisey but they close it to traffic at night. I rated this hotel as average but my spouse would rate it above average. My rating would be unique actually.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice staff, great location I'm surprised by some of the reviews of the hotel staff--we found them to be the most helpful on our trip to Italy. They were very good about making and/or canceling museum and tour reservations for us, and gave us wonderful dining recommendations every night. The hotel itself is old and charming--a couple of mosquitos but no big deal in the summer. The air conditioning worked great in our room, and it was clean. Breakfast was included but it was so-so--better off getting something elsewhere. The main reason to go to the Porta Rossa is the value and the location--you are within a street or two of everything terrific in Florence. We would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: linda528

Reviews.Content: Old Hotel, Old Service Booked a quiet room, only to get a room that shared a door adjacent to another room, subsequently we could hear the conversations of next door! Surly reception staff, unfriendly. One nice member of reception staff existed who switched on our air conditioning for us. Water failed to appear one morning but was soon fixed. Other than that great room, large, filled with old furniture, excellent beds, excellent air conditioning, good view, great location and a good breakfast.
